scalf.cmsc335.finalProject

Class TrafficController

  • java.lang.Object
    • scalf.cmsc335.finalProject.TrafficController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener, CarListener, Synchronizer, ViewListener

    public class TrafficController
extends java.lang.Object
implements Synchronizer, ViewListener, CarListener
    The thread manager of the program. This class communicates with the other objects in the program to handle the start, suspension, resumption, and stopping of threads.
    Author:
    Samuel Scalf
    Date:
    10 OCT 2020
    School:
    University of Maryland Global Campus
    Professor:
    Dr. Osama A. Morad, Ph.D.
    Course:
    CMSC 335 6380 Object-Oriented and Concurrent Programming (2208)

      private java.util.ArrayList<Car> cars
      Car threads.

      The primary thread manager.

      Used to alternate between left and right Cars

      Used by threads to obtain common lock without locking this entire object.

      private boolean started 
      private boolean stopped

    • Field Detail

      • lock

        private java.util.concurrent.locks.Lock lock
        Used by threads to obtain common lock without locking this entire object.

      • paused

        private volatile boolean paused

      • stopped

        private volatile boolean stopped

      • started

        private volatile boolean started

      • executor

        private java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService executor
        The primary thread manager.

      • tasks

        private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Runnable> tasks
        All non-Car tasks, such as lights and timestampers

      • cars

        private java.util.ArrayList<Car> cars
        Car threads. This was separated to better handle the removal of cars.

      • leftCar

        private boolean leftCar
        Used to alternate between left and right Cars

      • view

        private TrafficView view
        The GUI for the program.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TrafficController

        public TrafficController(TrafficView view)
        Default Constructor. Initializes the lock and data structures.
        Parameters:
        view - The GUI for the program.

    • Method Detail

      • isPaused

        public boolean isPaused()
        Specified by:
        isPaused in interface Synchronizer
        Returns:
        boolean whether paused or not

      • isStopped

        public boolean isStopped()
        Specified by:
        isStopped in interface Synchronizer
        Returns:
        boolean whether stopped or not

      • getLock

        public java.util.concurrent.locks.Lock getLock()
        Specified by:
        getLock in interface Synchronizer
        Returns:
        lock This object's stand-alone lock.

      • createTasks

        private void createTasks()
        Creates, but does not start, threads. This will clear out any tasks, if they exist, then get the lights and add a Timestamper.

      • createLights

        private void createLights()
        Creates the traffic lights. These lights are added to both the Runnable ArrayList and the TrafficView.

      • newLight

        private TrafficLight newLight(int x)
        Creates a traffic light starting on red with an offset time for changing lights.
        Parameters:
        x - The horizontal position of the light
        Returns:
        a new TrafficLight object

      • start

        private void start()
        Creates and starts tasks, if not already started. Sets the stopped and paused values to false.

        A CachedThreadPool was used to allow variable numbers of cars.

      • togglePause

        private void togglePause()
        Toggles the paused boolean and notifies all threads waiting on lock.

      • stop

        private void stop()
        Resets the controller. Sets booleans to default value, shuts down the CachedThreadPool, clears the data structures, and tells the TrafficView to reset, as well.

      • addCar

        private void addCar()
        Creates and starts a new Car thread with random velocity. Cars generated alternate between LeftCar and RightCar.

      • removeCar

        public void removeCar(Car car)
        Cancels and removes the specific car from the ArrayList.

        It does not matter if the thread takes a moment longer to fully stop, because a CachedThreadPool is being used. The Car will be removed from the ThreadPool as soon as it finishes.

        Specified by:
        removeCar in interface CarListener
        Parameters:
        car - the car to be removed

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        Performs the action for the relevant JButton.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        e - the JButton pressed in the TrafficView
